subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Back to work
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
Oh yeah! I got busy and forget the pix. I deleted the first ones I took. I 
did get another frame welded up, but set it aside due to weather, and so I 
could get these boards done. At the moment I don't have any of the newer 
boxes to use myself, but there's always EVPmaker, and the foreign language 
method.This week I'm ordering three more of the mini boards I did last 
spring. I have most of the parts I need for those, and I can make those 
systems very compact.

Frank

>From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Back to work
>Date: Sun, 7 Jan 2007 19:53:28 -0800 (PST)
>
>LOL Gee I wonder who got those =)
>
>   I think maybe it just takes longer because you realized you wanted to do 
>it a little different and that makes it a little more work for you. Make 
>sure you hang on to one of the ones that works the best for you.
>
>   I am still waiting for my tandem bike pics LOL
>
>   Misty
>
>Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
>   Winter vacation over! Not really a vacation, but the school district 
>closes
>down for the holidays, plus the added snow days!! I have the two proto 
>types
>boards complete, and funtional, at least as far as the individual sections
>go, now to test them in sessions. I must be getting older, cuz this stuff
>seems to take me forever anymore. I kept the shortwave converter, and I
>think I have a version that works better. I think I'll order three more of
>the micro boards, and combine those with home made radios to get some more
>systems put together quicker. I had three systems that I made using all
>surface mount components, and they were the most stable systems so far, and
>the most compact. I gave the first ones away, DOH!
>
>
>Frank
>
>
